SENT.plain: We have compared the in vitro and in vivo activities of three deglycosylated ricin A chain (dgA)-containing immunotoxins (ITs) with one versus two molecules of dgA per molecule of IgG
Two of the ITs (anti-CD19-dgA2 and anti-CD25-dgA2) had 3-0-fold improvements over their dgA1 counterparts in vitro
However, the in vivo anti-tumor activity of both constructs of each IT was the same
In contrast, anti-CD22-dgA2 was 7-fold more potent in vitro and significantly more potent in vivo than its dgA1 counterpart
These studies suggest that monoclonal antibodies must be individually tested to determine whether the addition of two versus one dgA will improve cytotoxic activity in vivo
